macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. stocks drift near record highs as defense sector rallies
items.summary: The S&P 500 traded about 0.1% lower in midday action, hovering near its all‑time high set earlier in the week, while the Dow Jones also slipped as broader Wall Street mostly moved sideways; defense stocks outperformed, extending recent gains.

items.title: Global equity markets edge lower as investors digest U.S. policy shifts and Venezuela tensions
items.summary: Global markets, including U.S. futures, European indexes, and major Asian benchmarks, traded slightly lower as investors weighed U.S. policy developments under President Trump and geopolitical moves by Venezuela, with defense shares in Europe bucking the trend and rising.

items.title: U.S. index futures soften after prior session declines in Dow and S&P 500
items.summary: U.S. S&P 500 futures slipped about 0.1% and Dow futures about 0.2% following a prior session in which the Dow fell roughly 0.9% from record levels and the S&P 500 also declined, while Nasdaq futures were marginally lower despite strength in select mega‑cap tech names.

items.title: European and Asian stocks slip, with Japan’s Nikkei hit by tech and AI pullback
items.summary: European markets opened mostly lower, tracking weaker U.S. and Asian sentiment, while Japan’s Nikkei 225 fell about 1.6% amid a sharp drop in AI and chip-related names such as SoftBank, and Hong Kong’s Hang Seng and China’s Shanghai Composite also posted modest declines.

items.title: Defense stocks rally in U.S. and Europe on higher spending outlook despite U.S. buyback concerns
items.summary: Defense companies in Europe and the U.S. rallied as investors reacted to President Trump’s call for U.S. defense spending to reach around $1.5 trillion, with names like BAE Systems and Leonardo leading gains in Europe, even as U.S. defense stocks had retreated the prior day on proposed limits to share buybacks.

items.title: Alphabet gains push valuation near $3.9 trillion despite weaker Nasdaq futures
items.summary: Alphabet shares rose about 2.4% in the prior U.S. session, lifting its market value to roughly $3.89 trillion and supporting the Nasdaq, even as Nasdaq 100 futures traded slightly down alongside broader market softness.

items.title: Dollar firms as traders scale back near-term Fed rate cut expectations ahead of jobs data
items.summary: The U.S. dollar index ticked higher after midweek economic data gave markets little impetus to price an additional near-term Federal Reserve rate cut, with attention turning to weekly jobless claims and the upcoming nonfarm payrolls report as Fed Governor Stephen Miran prepares to speak.

items.title: S&P 500 hovers near record as investors weigh strong labor data against Fed rate-cut timing
items.summary: After a recent pullback, the S&P 500 remained close to record territory, with traders watching robust U.S. labor indicators that could delay the first Fed rate cut of the year, keeping volatility subdued but capping further equity upside for now.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Recovers Above $90,000 as Crypto Market Cap Reaches $3 Trillion
items.summary: Bitcoin has surpassed $90,000 following a volatile end to 2025, with the total cryptocurrency market capitalization climbing above $3 trillion. The recovery marks a significant rebound from December lows near $85,000, though prices remain below the August 2025 all-time high of approximately $126,000.

items.title: Major Altcoins Show Mixed Performance; Solana Surges 15% in Early January
items.summary: Leading altcoins displayed varied momentum, with Solana (SOL) surging approximately 15% to around $150, supported by payment sector integration and DeFi ecosystem revival. XRP trades near $2.20 following Ripple's landmark 2025 SEC court victory, while Binance Coin (BNB) remains above $800 despite legal pressures on the exchange.

items.title: SEC Prepares 'Innovation Exemptions' for Crypto Securities Trading in Q1 2026
items.summary: The SEC under Chair Paul Atkins is expected to issue exemptive relief as early as the first quarter of 2026, allowing brokerages and crypto platforms to offer tokenized stocks and bonds with instant settlement outside certain National Market System requirements.

items.title: CLARITY Act Emerges as Centerpiece of 2026 Crypto Legislative Agenda
items.summary: A proposed market-structure bill known as the CLARITY Act has become the focal point of congressional crypto efforts, addressing investor protection, custody standards, and anti-money laundering rules. However, Democratic opposition to ethics provisions barring government officials from owning crypto exchanges threatens passage.

items.title: Florida Proposes New Bitcoin Reserve Bill Allowing Up to 10% State Crypto Investments
items.summary: Florida has revived its push for a state bitcoin reserve with a new 2026 bill permitting state-managed cryptocurrency investments of up to 10%, following similar initiatives in Wyoming and New Hampshire.

items.title: XRP Whale Activity Reaches Three-Month High Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Large XRP transactions have reached their highest levels in three months, signaling potential increased volatility in the token's price movements.

items.title: Bitcoin Mining Difficulty Decreases 1.20% at Block Height 931,392
items.summary: Bitcoin's mining difficulty has decreased by 1.20% at block height 931,392, potentially making mining more accessible and affecting network security dynamics.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Benchling and Lilly TuneLab partner to open access to proprietary AI drug discovery models
items.summary: Benchling announced a strategic collaboration with Eli Lilly’s TuneLab platform to let over 1,300 biotech customers run AI/ML prediction models for antibodies and small molecules directly within Benchling workflows, using models trained on decades of Lilly data representing more than $1 billion in R&D investment.[3][5]

items.title: BigHat Biosciences expands collaboration with Lilly to build generalizable antibody AI foundation models
items.summary: BigHat Biosciences announced a new collaboration with Eli Lilly through the Lilly TuneLab platform to advance machine-learning-enabled biologics discovery, using BigHat’s Milliner platform to generate diverse, high-quality datasets for a generalizable antibody developability foundation model.[4]

items.title: Accenture invests in Profitmind to scale agentic AI for retail decision optimization
items.summary: Accenture disclosed an investment in Profitmind, whose platform uses a network of intelligent AI agents combining machine learning, generative AI, and agentic AI to link pricing, inventory, promotions, and assortment data and generate explainable recommendations for retailers.[6]

items.title: Interview Kickstart launches advanced ML and agentic AI training program for software engineers
items.summary: Interview Kickstart introduced a new Advanced Machine Learning and Agentic AI Program 2026 aimed at helping experienced software engineers transition into ML and AI engineering roles, reflecting growing demand for AI-focused talent as traditional software roles see slower growth due to automation and AI-assisted development.[2]

items.title: AI industry weekly highlights: autonomous agents, next-gen AI chips, and healthcare automation
items.summary: A new AI Intelligence weekly briefing highlights regulatory scrutiny of major autonomous AI agent acquisitions, unveiling of next-generation AI computing architectures and embodied intelligence platforms at a major consumer tech expo, and advances in AI-powered medical imaging workflow automation, underscoring expanding applied and regulated AI use.[1]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct Announced for January 22
items.summary: Xbox announced its first Developer Direct of 2026, scheduled for January 22 at 1 PM ET. The presentation will feature extended gameplay reveals for Fable and Forza Horizon 6 (set in Japan), plus Game Freak's action RPG Beast of Reincarnation.

items.title: New Game Plus Showcase Debuts with 45 Games
items.summary: The inaugural New Game Plus Showcase aired on January 8, 2026, featuring 45 upcoming titles including Crimson Desert, Atomic Heart 2, The Blood of Dawnwalker, and various indie games with gameplay footage and developer interviews.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass January 2026 Wave 1 Adds Major Titles
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass added several notable games in January 2026, including Star Wars Outlaws, Resident Evil Village, Final Fantasy (remastered), and Lost in Random: The Eternal Die.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
